page.title: 13HOUSING
page.content: Besides the quoted examples which perhaps reflect the upper more mobile end of the market,there are also a number of estates owned both privately and by the local council. Generally the availabity and condition of the houses appear to be good. A particular feature of the older properties seems to be the{thatched roof and a thick cob wall.The thatches are expensive to maintain or renew but the main attractions ..besides their aesthetic quality..are the ability to maintain heat during the winter and a surprising coolness during the summer.There are not many thatchers around now but a few father and son firms can be found in Somerset..and work was going on in nearby Pitminster in 1985 for example.
